newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian stocks end weaker but off lows.
newsitem.headline: Australian stocks end weaker but off lows.

text.p: Australian shares closed weaker on Wednesday but were lifted off the midsession lows by bargain hunting in the afternoon session.
By the close, the All Ordinaries index lost 5.3 points to 2,376.7.
The leaders saw a choppy day's trading with few obvious trends. Most swung to and fro around square, but all closed off their lows as traders spotted value around the day's lows.
"You started to see some buying come back into it," said a Sydney-based dealer.
Activity was mixed with the day generally one of small losses or small gains and with the single figure end result widely expected.
"Banks were stronger and the gold index was slightly better. Most losses were in the transport, media and insurance," the dealer said.
Best performers among the leaders were major miners CRA and WMC, which both ended firmer at A$20.15 (US$16.33) and A$7.85 respectively.
Outside the leaders, though, the pace was frenetic in the small miners, particularly those prospecting in the Gawler Craton region in South Australia.

Helix Resources shares doubled in value to A$3.70 from A$1.85 after a drilling report early in the day that confirmed additional significant gold mineralisation at its Lake Everard Project in the Gawler Craton region.
Other miners with exploration interests in the area also rocketed as players punted on the region as a gold play.
Rises just shaded falls, while 30 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
